recipe_name: Dill herrings and quails' eggs canapés
author: Mary Berry
method: Slice each bread slice into 6 small squares and place on a board. Put the cream cheese, lemon juice, dill and pepper into a bowl and mix.  Spread a thin layer of the mixture over each square and top with a dill herring. Slice each quail egg into quarters and place a quarter on each square. Garnish with a sprig of dill and serve.
ingredients: 4 small slices rye bread,  100g/3½oz cream cheese,  1 tsp lemon juice,  1 tbsp chopped dill, plus extra sprigs for garnish,  freshly ground black pepper,  50g/1¾oz dill herrings, from a jar, cut into small squares,  6 quails eggs, hard-boiled and peeled
